item.title: Agile is dead!
item.description: Intro The premise is perhaps too dramatic and maybe a little click-catcher, but I think there is juice. Today when we talk about Agile everyone wants to have their say, everyone wants to apply their method with their thousand variations derived from their own experience. This leads me to ask myself some fundamental questions: What I miss Can a methodology determine success or failure, or only responsible for wasted resources? Why the fundamental concepts of Agile are not patterns that can be incorporated into any other methodology?
